data.title: Apple reportedly bought a video AI startup for $50 million as it tries to improve Siri and other apps (AAPL)
data.text: Apple added to its rapidly growing artificial intelligence portfolio earlier this year by acquiring Spain-based AI video startup Vilynx for approximately $50 million, Bloomberg reported Tuesday. Vilynx, headquartered in Barcelona, built software that leverages computer vision to analyze a video's visual, text, and audio content with the goal of "understanding" what's in the video, which helps it categorize and tag metadata, generate automated video previews, and recommend related content, according to an earlier version of its website.

data.title: Big Tech stocks are flashing buy signals, Jim Cramer says
data.text: "The charts, as interpreted by Katie Stockton, suggest that Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix, Google and Microsoft ... are ready to roll higher," the "Mad Money" host said.

data.title: Apple has acquired a video-focused AI company: report
data.text: Apple Inc. has reportedly acquired Vilynx, an artificial-intelligence company based in Spain, according to Bloomberg. The report, which cites multiple unnamed sources, said that Apple scooped up Vilynx earlier this year and may use the company's AI and computer-vision technologies to analyze video content and improve the way Apple employs artificial intelligence in its apps.

data.title: Apple Earnings Expected To Reflect Work-At-Home Trend
data.text: On Thursday (Oct. 29) Apple releases its Q4 earnings report — the last glimpse inside Apple the public will get this calendar year and the firm's update on how it has managed its pandemic economics before the holiday shopping season spins fully into gear. Apple has had an undeniably good year thus far in terms […]

data.title: How Apple's accessories business will continue fueling revenue growth
data.text: At Apple's latest earnings call in July, CFO Luca Maestri noted that the company's Wearables, Home, and Accessories (WH&A) business alone had grown to the size of a Fortune 140 company. The segment brought in $6.5 billion that quarter (Q3 2020, for the three months ended July 30, 2020), representing a 17% increase year over year (YoY).

data.title: Can Continued Services Momentum Aid Apple (AAPL) Q4 Earnings?
data.text: Apple's (AAPL) fourth-quarter fiscal 2020 results are expected to reflect expanding Services business as well as solid iPad and Mac sales amid the coronavirus pandemic-induced chaos.

data.title: What Apple Stands to Lose From Lawsuit Against Google
data.text: Any scaled-down version of Apple's strategic relationship with Google would have a negative impact in the immediate and longer term.

data.title: Google Antitrust Suit Could Upend Apple's Services Business
data.text: The U.S. Justice Department's antitrust lawsuit against Internet behemoth Google could have major repercussions for Apple. Google is estimated to pay Apple between $8 billion to $12 billion a year to be the default search engine on Apple's iDevices.

data.title: Apple: Whether It's Time To Buy The Stock
data.text: We expect Apple's earnings to beat expectations by 25%, based on resilient product sales driven from work from home & online learning transitions, as well as increasing service revenue. While the market responded poorly to the iPhone 12 launch, which saw Apple shares drop 7% in the week that followed, current valuations and technicals appear positive for the stock.
